website_summaries.verdict: A great design for right-handed or left-handed people, but it isn't as customizable as some other brands.
pros: The central position of the trackball makes it easy to use in either hand
The handheld design makes it easy to use for those dealing with carpal tunnel
cons: This mouse doesn't come with any software, so it's not programmable
Also, some buyers say the trackball is almost too sensitive and can be hard to get used to

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: My biggest gripe with this trackball is that the ball itself does not appear to have a consistent weight, because upon lifting my finger, the ball often travels by itself, up to half an inch or more, which I can only assume is caused by it being heavier on part of the ball. This behavior was very reproducible and happened 1/3rd to 1/2 of the time I tried it. This of course causes the mouse to move all over the screen. Other than this, the quality of the trackball seemed good, and I did not have any problems installing it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Works Great in Bed
customer_reviews.text: Very handy when surfing the web in bed. The picture does not describe how to use it. The thumb is on the trackball never touching the wheel. The wheel is best operated with your palm. The trigger is the Left mouse. The upper right button is Enter. The upper left button is Esc. Both lower left and right button next to the wheel is the Right mouse. WIN10 'Enhance point precision' should be turned on. The DPI setting does not seem to make a difference. Because it is RF, and not IR, it works through pillows.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect but good enough
customer_reviews.text: The track ball is out of balance and it moves when you leave it in a desired position, but this can be overcome by setting the pointer speed down. Over all this mouse is going to work for me . Among many important maneuvers, I am able to mouse to small handles in CAD drawings and move them . I have to incorporate my left hand to pan the drawing because I cant hold down the wheel and move the track ball at the same time, but this is not going to be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: not a realistic replacement for a mouse
customer_reviews.text: I have medium to large size hands, this device felt a bit small. Using the rollerball was difficult for any fine adjustments of the cursor, it had a tendency to keep jumping around which made it very frustrating. Selecting something as you would do with the left button on your mouse was awkward, you had to hold your hand very still or the mouse would jump around, again frustrating. The product I received was used not new as the batteries were already installed and the protective wrapping was from something else. Not only was this disappointing but I’m sure there are consumer laws against that.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Try a different brand.
customer_reviews.text: This device barely works. The trigger button requires more of a 'click and hold' than just a click to work - and it is so mushy that you can't really tell if you've actually clicked it. The trackball is so fast that it leaps across the screen and seems to be very nervous when trying to hit buttons or small action links on the screen. Plus, because the ball is loosely fitting, when you lift your thumb off of the ball - it tends to jump a little - which causes it to be off whatever you are trying to click on by the time you try to click.
customer_reviews.author: Robin D. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for its size and versatile.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent ergonomics. Can even mouse behind your back. Very versatile. I am a radiologist and use it at my workstation. It keeps me from leaning over and reaching forward to mouse all day. Sometimes work 14 hours straight. It is nice that I can use the trackball and the scroll wheel. I love the trigger left click. Would be even better if the two furthest buttons were programmable but not a game changer for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth it consider its missing features.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse hopeful I'd be able to use it for a very long time but a few key features make it pretty worthless for me. The first isn't not having an automatic off. Every wireless mouse I've purchased since 2005 has had an automatic off feature but this one still relies on the hard switch off. I've had this thing dead more times than I've been able to use it. There is no way to scroll up and down with the mouse itself as well. Overall I'd avoid this if you're looking for a mouse to use regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Easy learning curve
customer_reviews.text: I love that its ambidextrous, even if you're not its still super to use with either hand. I knew it was a keeper when I started teaching for it more than the trackpad on my laptop or more than my regular mouse. Love that you dont need a surface to use it on, you can use it standing away from your desk or reclining on the couch. My only issue is that the ball isn't super accurate despite the device setting options. Also wish it had a pointer light. And the quality doesn't feel sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: momo

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for teachers
customer_reviews.text: I'm a teacher and found this to address my problem of manipulating the computer while across the room dealing with students. The remote for the projector and other devices are only good for presentations but with this I can switch between applications, click on embedded links, and browse the web just like if I was at my PC. I can teach from anywhere in the classroom and bring up resources for student development on screen. This has done wonders for classroom management!
customer_reviews.author: SATXRunner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my smart tv
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use as an addition to my smart tv remote. Easier to navigate the apps and use onscreen keyboards with this rather than up and down arrows on the tv remote. Works perfect so far. I didn't notice the trackball moving on its own like other reviews have mentioned. I don't know if that is something that will become a problem later on. If so, i will update this review, I like that it has an on/off switch so I can't accidentally interrupt a program by moving it. It is a little smaller than I thought it would be but it isn't really an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Moore

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Last
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these one for work and one for home, in October 2018 both died in May 2020. It's a shame that there are only 2 different styles for hand held track ball mice and neither of them really good, more like average. This mouse did save me a lot of times, so I ordered the same thing but wired, will see how long that will last hopefully at least a few years... Just to add, this could give you a cramp, this mouse should be just a bit larger to fit in the hand and have two trigger buttons for left and right.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Shestakov

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Impressed by this device, it definitely helps with ergonomics for challenging setups and for multi-computer setups. It's very responsive, I haven't tried switching the ball for a steel ball bearing as suggested by other comments yet but also haven't had any issues with using the trackball. I will say that it's important to let go of the trackball when clicking, otherwise you'll end up inadvertently moving the trackball as you click. No noticeable lag which is important. It would be nice to reprogram the Enter and Escape keys, but overall I'm very pleased with this device.
customer_reviews.author: DaDueler

customer_reviews.title: Not Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping this would have given me a little more freedom to move about while still maintaining control of my computer, but unfortunately the range is terrible. I have a completely unobstructed path to my computer with this device and can't get 10ft of usable range. After about 6ft it becomes erratic and useless. Aiming it in different directions doesn't help, and replacing the battery didn't help either. I have a wireless keyboard and glide-pad that work flawlessly, so I am convinced that this product just doesn't offer good range. I will be sending it back, and may go to a corded model.
customer_reviews.author: T Man

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse! It is so comfortable and easy to use. I use both thumbs to control the track ball. It is very accurate with a great touch to it. I'd surely buy this mouse again and would totally recommend it. It's especially useful when only the mouse is needed in an application. Not as handy when using the keyboard also, as you would have to put down the mouse before typing. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Dorfy

customer_reviews.title: No secure place to put reciever. Battery door poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get to use this enough to tell if it worked well. Other wireless mouses have a secure compartment to hold the receiver but not this one. Some may buy this for travel because of it's size but the ease to lose the receiver makes it a poor choice. Also I got the battery door off but it won't go back on.
customer_reviews.author: H R Rumph

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful mouse/trackball
customer_reviews.text: Really nice. A couple problems I had: at first the trackball was really shaky and kinda hard to control, but I used the DPI? button and it got better. The scroll wheel is directly under the trackball, which means I have to shift my hand to switch between them. I think it would be a bit better if the scroll wheel was offset, but then it wouldn't be ambidextrous, so... Both of these are very minor concerns. I would definitely recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Worked Pretty Well for Two Months
customer_reviews.text: This mouse worked pretty well for two months, but then the track ball control got worse and worse until it became very difficult to control the cursor accuracy and location. it's too bad because I got it due to a shoulder injury - and it was helpful at first. But, once it started losing its effectiveness I messaged the company and they did not reply. It's definitely not worth more than $5 if its only going to last 2 months - and if the company won't stand behind the product.
customer_reviews.author: Rocco2000

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: At first it seems like it might take some time to get used to it but it really becomes second nature quickly. Buttery smooth movement with the trackball. There is a small button to change the dpi level (which doesn't seem to change much for me) that sort of irritates my finger and I wish it weren't there - but its only a slight annoyance. I bought two and gave one as a gift, my brother loves it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Schroder

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative, but not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a little over a year before the ball stopped working, but had to remove bits of broken magnet in the ball socket a couple of times. If tilted left/right (as if you are holding it to use), the ball shifts on its own and moves on the screen - should be spring loaded or design which eliminates this. No more sore wrist with this mouse - if you have doubts, don't. I can have my arm hanging naturally and even resting on my leg and do work.
customer_reviews.author: E. Slater

customer_reviews.title: Stopped connecting after less than a week of light use
customer_reviews.text: Good concept, but poor execution. Made of cheap-feeling plastic. The pointer was not exceptionally accurate and the LMB trigger is too stiff. It typically took about 10 seconds to connect after powering it on. After using it for less than a week, it stopped connecting altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I find this product completely satisfactory. I got it, because using the touch pad on my laptop is causing a lot of pain in my hand. This product solves that problem. I have medium sized hands so it fits me well. Large hands might have difficulty. When you attach this product to your computer you may have to adjust the mouse settings to accommodate the way you work.
customer_reviews.author: Isn't it obvious

customer_reviews.title: WILL NOT WORK, NO MATTER WHAT I DO.
customer_reviews.text: SOFTWARE INSTALLED CORRECTLY. PLUGED IN THE USB RECEIVER INTO COMPUTER. CHECKED BATTERY ON THE HAND HELD TRACKBALL FRAME - GOOD BATTERY. BUT IT WON'T DO ANYTHING. I HAVE THE WIRED MODEL THAT WORKS FINE. GUESS I'LL HAVE TO STICK WITH THE WIRED TRACKBALL ONE.
customer_reviews.author: happykono

customer_reviews.title: A little buggy but it does work
customer_reviews.text: I prefer a trackball to a mouse and have a Logitech trackball on my desktop. Sometimes I am viewing things away from my seat/desk. I chose this one due to the scroll wheel. The left and right buttons are kind of hard to reach except for the one you push with your index hinger. Could use some improvements but it does work.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: REPLACE the ball with a 3/4" Steel Ball Bearing...
customer_reviews.text: Hey, I liked this mouse out of the box. I'd give it 5 stars to start, but after reading another review here that recommended replacing the ball with a 3/4" steel ball bearing, I LOVE it even more. I use it on the end of a home-build collective for helicopter flight simulation, and it works great. The build is a little cheap, but for what I needed it for, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Little Gadget
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this little thing. It lets me sit back in comfort and still have good control. I ordered the stainless steel ball another reviewer recommended but the stock ball has a much smoother roll to me. Its built a little cheep but functions excellent. PLUG & PLAY. No drivers needed. What do you want for $30. If it breaks Ill just purchase another. ITS WELL WORTH IT.
customer_reviews.author: Frank III

customer_reviews.title: Died in less than 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for just under 3 weeks, and was happy with it until this morning, when it died. Changing the battery did not help. It's a shame, because it was very comfortable to use. But something that lasts less than 3 weeks is not worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Rosanne D.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Wireless Finger Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Love this finger mouse. We have used this type of mouse for some time now and find it easier on the wrist then a regular mouse. They seem to last quite a long time although we have always had the rechargeable one. This one is updated to a 2.4 and requires a battery. So far it works the same as the others. I highly recommend this finger mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Goz

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Even with fresh batteries, this mouse disconnects after a couple minutes. Disconnect/Reconnecting the dongle restores functionality for a moment, but it doesn't last. Entirely unusable unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Spam Weishoff

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is abysmal!
customer_reviews.text: I like the mouse. I bought it for relief of my wrist pain with most other devices. But the battery life is horrible. Even turning the mouse off at each use does not help. Not worth with that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Todd A. Weber

customer_reviews.title: It works kind of
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by stating I have big hands , friends have called them bear paws. So this trackball mouse feel slightly too small but useable. The directions are not the best and I can’t get the laser pointer to work. No big deal , I don't really need it. Despite all this I use this mouse daily, recommend , and am not looking for another mouse. Btw I use a MAC.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: It is comfortable and allows me to lean away from the computer
customer_reviews.text: It is comfortable and allows me to lean away from the computer, relaxing neck, shoulder and back. Only draw back so far is the roller ball is uber sensitive and continues to move after letting up. It makes it very hard to locate the curser before clicking. The ball needs to have a drag instead of just free wheeling.
customer_reviews.author: Tim McRoberts

customer_reviews.title: Worked for one day, then died!!
customer_reviews.text: The first one arrived in the mail and worked fine for one day, then died!! I sent it back and was promptly sent a new replacement in about 5 days!! great response!! The new one is a week old and has worked fine,,,, so far??? Keeping my fingers crossed!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: wtault

customer_reviews.title: It's working very good now. At first it didn't work for 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: It's working very good now. At first it didn't work for 2 different pc's. I noticed the first time I plugged in the usb plug it said "device found." But not when I'd retry. I looked in device manager under the usb section and watched the screen as I took the usb plug in and out. I found that the plug I received needs to be about 1/8" or so from being all the way in the usb port to work. Now to see how long a battery lasts. I like that it has an on/off switch.
customer_reviews.author: phuntwv

customer_reviews.title: Meh!
customer_reviews.text: Works for basic functions. But why does it have 5 buttons for 4 functions. Why are two buttons dedicated to one function. Why is one button dedicated to exit and the other enter. Why is there now software or driver provided to remap it. Even using software like x-mousebutton control it is impossible to remap buttons 2 and 3 to separate functions. impossible to remap buttons 4 and 5 as well. So take it as it is. There is also NO SUPPORT whatsoever
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Great idea.... for as long as it works.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Nice to use if using laptop while sitting in a recliner. Easy setup w/ Win10. Ball is a little too loose, but works great. Update from my original great review: The unit just stopped working 6 months after I bought it. Out of warranty, of course.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic!!! I'm a video editor, so I use the mouse regularly. I started to get this horrible pain in my hand and arm, so I tried multiple kinds of mice...none helped. Then I tried this one, and the pain is completely gone. The only downside is that you cannot reprogram the buttons. I did reprogram the middle button using ATNSOFT Key Manager.
customer_reviews.author: Vanna

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control, junk
customer_reviews.text: First one ordered worked okay at first, so bought a second one. Second one was DOA. Now first one does not work either. Junk. Too much bother to return.
customer_reviews.author: Art S

customer_reviews.title: Works great at times and others it fails frustratingly
customer_reviews.text: Works great at times and others it fails frustratingly. Wash your hands throughly before using, body oil or dirt will cause malfunctions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: This handheld mouse has very good tracking, but could be improved. The laser pointer did not work at all in my case. Also, it could use an upgrade to USB rechargeable, not simply a AAA battery. All four click buttons, as well as the scroll wheel should be located above the track ball, not two above and two below.
customer_reviews.author: Trevis Wray

customer_reviews.title: Also easy to back up slides as well
customer_reviews.text: VERY handy for presentations with remote attendees - by moving the mouse the remote attendees can see what you're pointing to, unlike a laser pointer. Also easy to back up slides as well. I've only used this with Powerpoint, so I can't speak to how well it works with other applications.
customer_reviews.author: PRDMAMA

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control Issues
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly I didn't start using it much until recently and it broke after only a few uses. The battery compartment is unnecessarily difficult to open and the quality of plastic used is very cheap even in consideration for a device at this price point. The advertised functionality seemed promising, but this particular device I'd recommend passing on.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: saves my hand from fatigue. Helps relieve my carpel tunnel when I'm working for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Jichen D.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay connected
customer_reviews.text: It is awesome when it works. I have to keep unplugging and plugging in the dongle to get it to connect. If you leave it and don't use if for awhile it will stop working unless you reconnect the dongle even power cycling the device does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: Great for a presentation but the ball is so so. Replaced it with a ball bearing and it's a little better but not much.
customer_reviews.author: james buck

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only 90 days
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok for a while, with some periods of being erratic, then quit completely....put in new battery...still dead. Overpriced even if it continued to work.
customer_reviews.author: LowTechTom

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This helps me be able to sit back and scroll through the page or point and click. You do have to set the mouse down to be able to type, but that is expected. Works well......
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. I should have been using this years ago. Helps reduce stress on hand/arm/neck. Use this to control your pc, browse internet or play slow paced games, then use your gaming mouse for precision action games. Definitely not a replacement for your main, but use in addition to
customer_reviews.author: DMD

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: good connection. response is immediate. I wish the roller ball was more tight fitting and able to change button layout.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If the stupid scroll wheel was in a better position
customer_reviews.text: Dude, for the price, and for what it is, I really only have one issue, If the stupid scroll wheel was in a better position, this would be the best thing ever. As of now, I find it incredibly useful for when I'm just surfing aimlessly. For years, I'd just space out and look at crap for hours while remaining in that mousing position for no good reason. Now, I just sit comfortably. It actually is a great purchase. Ergonomics aside.
customer_reviews.author: Hubba-Hubba

customer_reviews.title: Teachers dream
customer_reviews.text: I am a teacher and use this with my smart board. AMAZING PRODUCT - I highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Sullymom

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't a fan of this one.
customer_reviews.text: There was really no instructions and I still can't make 3 of the buttons work. It moves the cursor a d I can left click in things
customer_reviews.author: joshua

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: It's OK and fits the need for hand held mouse, but it's cheap quality, the ball is loose, and the buttons are not all where they need to be for easy accessibility.
customer_reviews.author: Steedee

customer_reviews.title: wireless  better than the wired version-- no wire in the way
customer_reviews.text: We tried the wired finger mouse and liked it a lot. We decided to get this wireless one; found it easy to use and a real good fit for my small hand as well as my husband larger hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small in size
customer_reviews.text: The concept is great. The issue is the size. I have average sized male hands and it is way too small. I felt like I had to push it forward to be able to use the main tack ball. It was difficult to use the "right click" buttons and the scroll wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Rarely post

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after a couple weeks
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after a couple weeks. Tried all the normal remedies to fix: changed battery, reinstalled on pc, rebooted pc, trouble shootted through pc settings. Nothing worked.
customer_reviews.author: Big A

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easy
customer_reviews.text: I have my laptop connected to my TV I can just sit back on the couch and use this little handheld wireless trackball mouse control everything can you ask for anything more?
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this junk.
customer_reviews.text: It just stopped working. What a piece of junk. I was just getting use to it and boom, done. I wish I would have used it sooner so I could have got a refund. Too late now I'm sure. I've been ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey McGrath

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I was having elbow pain reaching for a normal mouse. Now I can sit back relaxed with this new mouse. It's very intuitive to use. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well. The whole thing though is a big ...
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well. The whole thing though is a big oversized. Hard to handle even in my husbands hands. If they made this a bit smaller, it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jay S

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Work great on my laptop the only issue I have is I cannot remap buttons for what I want them to be. I can only swap left/right buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wood

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: Got these due to a hand operation and using a mouse hurts. These take a little getting use to, but then they are great. You can set back. you don't need to lean over the desk.
customer_reviews.author: Dilly

customer_reviews.title: Great for adventure games!
customer_reviews.text: Well made and easy to use, really nice for point and click adventure games- saves a lot of stress on the back and arms being able to kick back and maintain precise control. Definitely grab the steel ball and pop it in there, the weight keeps the arrow exactly where you leave it no matter how much you move the controller around.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Probably the most comfortable, convenient mouse device I've ever used!
customer_reviews.text: Very handy device, especially if you're not tied to your desk when using your computer.
customer_reviews.author: alan mande

customer_reviews.title: Needed an alternative but this  simply doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The track ball is worthless, only two of the five buttons actually work, not ergonomic.
customer_reviews.author: Morrie Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Nice mouse for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Mouse has nice action. I use it while running on my treadmill and it serves its purpose well. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ds

customer_reviews.title: It works great! I use it in my classroom and it ...
customer_reviews.text: It works great! I use it in my classroom and it works in every spot in the room!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Feldman

customer_reviews.title: ... this into a wireless control application and it works great. The scroll wheel speed is adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Integrating this into a wireless control application and it works great. The scroll wheel speed is adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: RandyJ

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in March & it stopped working by December. Initially it was great for my purpose (have a computer hooked up to TV / entertainment system), but disappointed it barely lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this manufacturer, no quality control.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two both were dead on arrival, tried fresh batteries and everything. ONE had a usb plug that was bent out of shape and wouldn't even plug into any usb port it was so damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Donald Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Stiffed
customer_reviews.text: Product stopped working after limited use. Good design, bad reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Fideliter

customer_reviews.title: Vert helpful, need one to control computer from across ...
customer_reviews.text: Vert helpful, need one to control computer from across the room while it is hooked up to tv and it works just as needed.
customer_reviews.author: holly o.

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect alternative to a regular mouse or track ball
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect alternative to a regular mouse or track ball. I wish they made them in a rechargeable model
customer_reviews.author: Tobyluv

customer_reviews.title: and is very comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: Have previously used one and they work just flawless. The use of the finger mouse is much easier on your wrist, and is very comfortable to use. I just love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: Nice mousy!
customer_reviews.text: This is really helpful if you have any wrist or elbow issues from using a "standard" mouse. Sometimes I have to shake it to get it to work right.
customer_reviews.author: RPAmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: Great size & grip for ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: Love this, except the trackball is taking me some time to get used to. Right out of the box, though, my impression is great. Synced with my iMac with no trouble. Super light; feels great in my small hand -- not too bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Angrybiker

customer_reviews.title: skip
customer_reviews.text: would skip around randomly and had a range of barely 5 ft. Don't waste your money or time
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Takes a bit to get used to but really nice for laptop and tablet use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for sketching.
customer_reviews.text: This a great device for drawing and sketching. Very ergonomic and the right size. The only inconvenience that I would remark is the hustle to get your finger in and out of the device to use the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: adolfo

customer_reviews.title: worked great for about 2 months
customer_reviews.text: this was fantastic for the 2 months or so it worked! eventually the track ball just stopped working. for awhile if you blew on it, to get the dust out i guess, it would work ok. but now not even that gets it to work. annoyed i wasted my money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie White

customer_reviews.title: Good product on the whole
customer_reviews.text: Good product on the whole, but it does have a couple issues. The ring around the trackball is nigh-impossible to remove, so cleaning is difficult, and the two buttons above the trackball seem not to do anything, and are definately non-programmable. For $30.00, though, it's not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: chapman

customer_reviews.title: Even the replacement broke.
customer_reviews.text: The first one broke after one click. Literally. The replacement lasted two weeks and then stopped.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: No more repetitive strain injury!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT, but my first one broke after 2 months. I got another one bc nothing else compares. This helped get rid of the excruciating pain I was experiencing from repetitive strain injury.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Love this little mouse for presenting on a projector or just scrolling the internet on the tablet pc. If the scroll button was a little more conveniently placed it would be a 5 star!!
customer_reviews.author: Scot Hornby

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality and works well
customer_reviews.text: Trackball is very responsive and has 4 DPI settings. Right click is in a little bit of an odd place, but other than that it works flawlessly!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan B.

customer_reviews.title: It has been very useful for that
customer_reviews.text: I am right handed, bought this device in anticipation of right rotator cuff surgery. It has been very useful for that. Was recognized by multiple operating systems with no problem, including Win 7, Win 10, Mint, and Zorin. Loses a star for documentation and website being very basic. Loses another star because receiver got hung up in USB port of a Lenovo W530, cannot get it out. Tried everything short of breaking it. Website and documentation gave no apparent clues on how to get a replacement receiver. I wish Logitech made this device under Unity, that would be great.
customer_reviews.author: papermaker

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Being a ball mouse fan anyway, the wireless single hand use is great for when you're not in front of your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Jhdrumhead.

customer_reviews.title: No need for mouse pad, saves room on desk
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy the trackball and left click in center button.
customer_reviews.author: A. Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse
customer_reviews.text: Used the wired version of this for years. Had to pick up the wireless one. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Alkline

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse for travel.
customer_reviews.text: nice for when I'm on the road. I wouldn't want to use it all day.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Hatlestad

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: First there were no instruction. The On Off are hidden from view. It doesn't work as accurately PS I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: phishbowl14

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Allows me to control my mouse while I walk around the classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Carter

customer_reviews.title: and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in mid-2016, this device has held up perfectly. It is light and compact, and easy to use: just right for use when lecturing. Battery life is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: DRT

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Plug in and play on my Windows 7 and 10 computers
customer_reviews.author: Angel Acosta

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I loved it when it worked...then it stopped working. I wrote customer support back in January and they would ship another one in February. Here we are in August and they never sent me a replacement :(
customer_reviews.author: Sarah S.

customer_reviews.title: Not Working
customer_reviews.text: Four months into using this mouse and it has stopped working. The roller ball does not appear to be functioning anymore but buttons are working fine, will have to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Doreen Allison

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Durable I've dropped it several times to no I'll effect
customer_reviews.author: Gnollmore

customer_reviews.title: A great alternative to a mouse.
customer_reviews.text: I love using this. A great alternative to a mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: THUMB ROLLER BALL AND BATTERY
customer_reviews.text: This mouse relieves the stress on my fingers and wrist, However the thumb roller ball is so loose its like trying to a swat a fly while blindfolded The AAA battery lasts only a week.
customer_reviews.author: Lizard

customer_reviews.title: Good secondary mouse. Great for browsing from afar
customer_reviews.text: I’ve migrated mainly to YouTube/Netflix/streaming on my comp’s extra monitor. This mouse is perfect for watching in bed or across the room. Don’t expect it as a primary mouse
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: right click and scroll wheel positions could be better. Overall i like it
customer_reviews.text: right click and scroll wheel positions could be better. Overall i like it. This is my first time with any hand held mosue.
customer_reviews.author: SB

product_meta.title: YUMQUA Y-10W 2.4 GHz Portable Finger Handheld Wireless USB Trackball Mouse for PC Laptop Mac Lovers
product_meta.description:
Description:



Wireless handheld mouse design, off-table use in the air, no operating space restriction, which is also suitable and convenient for living room multimedia center, convenient button controls let you able to operate when you're sitting, leaning, lying down or other body posture.










Specific:



1, Left and right hand design



2, Works with ALL operating systems, like Windows version / ME / 2000 / XP /NT/WIN7/WIN10 operating systems, including MAC OS,Android OS, tablet.



3, Interface PS/2 or USB.



4, Resolution 1200 dpi. *Four group adjust DPI:400,600,800,1200



5, Effective distance within 10M.



6,Working Frequency 2.4GHz.



7, Help prevent Musculo-Skeletal Disorders










Notice:YUMQUA Y-10W Trackball Mouse does not have Laser Pointer Function.

If you want a mouse has laser function, please search YUMQUA Y-10L Trackball Mouse on Amazon.








Package Included:



1 X Wireless Finger Handheld USB Mouse Mice Trackball Mouse



1 X receiver



1 X introduction book



1 X AAA battery










FA & Q



1, All the mouse we sell have 3 months warranty, if you had any questions, please contact the seller(in the package) directly instead of Amazon customer service.



2,If the mouse movement becomes difficult, you may try to used some liquid wax to wiping it. Problem solved!

Trackball mouse with scroll: Interface PS/2 or USB. Compatible System: Windows 98/ 2000 / XP / VISTA / Win7/ Win10/ Linux / Unix / Mac OS/ Android OS.
Four group adjust DPI:400,600,800,1200. Effective distance within 10M.
Ergonomic Design: Cordless trackball mouse can greatly ease the harm of palm joint or muscle for long time using mouse.
Ambidextrous design mouse for left or right-handed users. Any questions with this product, please contact us, we will reply in 24 hours.
